since_last_update: Macro narrative broadened from “CPI-whipsaw risk” to include a fiscal/term-premium overhang after CBO’s February 2026 outlook highlighted structurally higher deficits/debt and rising interest-cost trajectory (FT, Axios).
Rates-sensitive risk is now two-layered into Friday’s CPI: near-term inflation print risk plus medium-term supply/term-premium pressure (CBO framing + refunding/auction cycle) (FT, U.S. Treasury).

Cross-asset tone: pre-CPI positioning appears mildly risk-on in index futures while nominal yields eased; gold is softer vs the prior session’s strong-jobs/“cuts delayed” impulse (Barron’s, Yahoo Finance).
Micro driver shift toward earnings dispersion: notable single-name gaps are a meaningful index-futures input (especially Nasdaq) even if macro is the dominant tail risk into CPI (Barron’s, IBD).
today_focus: Dominant driver today: “CPI tomorrow” positioning with modest relief from easing long-end yields into the cash open; supports ES/NQ beta but keeps convexity to any inflation surprise elevated (Barron’s, IBD).
Earnings as the immediate tape-level driver for Nasdaq: Cisco/AppLovin weakness vs pockets of strength elsewhere = high dispersion and index-level cross-currents (IBD, Barron’s).
Long-end supply/term-premium check: Treasury 30-year auction is the main structural risk event today for duration and duration-equities sensitivity (U.S. Treasury).
Gold focus: pressured by the “strong jobs → later cuts/firm real rates” narrative, with near-term direction likely subordinated to CPI outcomes and real-yield/dollar impulse (Yahoo Finance).

market_pricing.dominant_narrative: Pre-CPI positioning with yields easing + earnings dispersion; fiscal/term-premium concerns sit in the background as a medium-horizon pressure point.

rates.what_seems_priced: Market is behaving as if near-term macro risk is concentrated in CPI tomorrow; today’s modest yield easing suggests no panic bid for inflation hedges at the margin.
rates.what_seems_underpriced: A CPI upside print that forces a sustained repricing higher in real yields AND re-anchors term premium via supply/fiscal narrative (two-factor tightening).
rates.transmission_to_equities: Equity duration (NQ > ES) remains highly sensitive to real-yield moves; a weak auction or CPI upside would likely tighten financial conditions quickly.

equities.what_seems_priced: Near-term resilience/“buy-the-dip” bias into CPI with futures green, despite visible earnings landmines.
equities.what_seems_underpriced: Correlation risk: a CPI upside surprise could flip the session to a rates-led de-risk where single-name earnings winners don’t insulate the index.

gold.what_seems_priced: Gold is tracking the ‘cuts delayed’ impulse after strong jobs; near-term softness consistent with firmer real-rate expectations.
gold.what_seems_underpriced: A CPI downside print that drives real yields down sharply could re-ignite gold bid even if risk-on; alternatively, fiscal/term-premium stress could create ‘gold up with yields up’ correlation breaks (lower confidence).

usd_fx.what_seems_priced: Near-term USD impulse likely deferred to CPI; today’s focus is rates vol rather than a clear FX trend signal.
usd_fx.what_seems_underpriced: If CPI surprises, USD reaction could be nonlinear via real-rate differentials; would feed back into gold and NQ multiples.

volatility_positioning.what_seems_priced: Implied vol appears contained into CPI relative to the size of potential macro gap risk (inference from ‘futures up / VIX futures down’ tone).
volatility_positioning.what_seems_underpriced: Second-order vol from auction tail + CPI (back-to-back) creating liquidity air pockets around key levels.

risk_register.risk: US CPI (Feb 13) upside surprise drives abrupt real-yield repricing; hits duration equities (NQ) and can pressure gold via higher real rates (dominant near-term tail).
US CPI downside surprise triggers aggressive easing expectations (risk-on initially) but raises growth-scare interpretation risk; can create whipsaw across ES/NQ and rates.
30-year auction tails (weak demand) steepens long end/raises term premium; negative for rate-sensitive equities independent of CPI direction.
Fiscal/deficit narrative (CBO outlook) reasserts as a market driver, reinforcing term-premium drift higher and crowding out duration risk appetite.
risk_register.timeframe: this week to next few weeks

risk_register.risk: Earnings dispersion shock: large single-name gaps (notably in tech/comm services) spill into NQ index volatility even if macro is quiet intraday.

event_warnings: US 30-year Treasury auction today: watch for tail/indirect bidder strength as a term-premium signal into CPI (U.S. Treasury).
US CPI (Feb 13, high impact): primary catalyst for front-end/real-yield repricing and cross-asset correlation shifts (calendar input).
US Existing Home Sales today: usually secondary, but can matter if it reinforces a ‘housing slowing’ vs ‘rates staying high’ narrative into CPI (calendar input).
Fed speakers (Logan, Miran) after today: could amplify or damp CPI-derived policy-path interpretation (calendar input).
